unnormalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Film buffs, get your popcorn ready! It's film festival season, and things are heating up faster than a plate of biryani on a Delhi summer afternoon.
normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Film buffs, get your popcorn ready! It's film festival season, and things are heating up faster than a plate of biryani on a Delhi summer afternoon. Word on the street is that the Jaipur International Film Festival is gearing up for another amazing edition, promising a vibrant mix of indie flicks and established directors. Meanwhile, whispers are circulating about a potential focus on South Indian cinema at the Mumbai Film Festival this year. Think Rajinikanth retrospectives! But it's not just the big leagues. Smaller, independent festivals are popping up like mushrooms after the monsoon, showcasing the talents of emerging filmmakers from across India and beyond. From short film showcases in Kerala to documentaries tackling social issues in Chhattisgarh, there's something for everyone. And hey, if you're planning a trip to Kerala during Onam, keep an eye out for pop-up screenings celebrating regional cinema. Free films and festive cheer? Now that's a combo better than masala dosa and sambar! Grab your auto and head down there!
